question.body: Carbon dioxide is carried in the blood in three different forms. Which form is least common and can diffuse from the tissues into the blood?

response.feedback: Correct. About 7-10% of carbon dioxide is carried in the blood plasma as a dissolved gas. This is the form of carbon dioxide that can diffuse from the tissues into the blood.
Incorrect. Between 20%-23% of carbon dioxide is attached to hemoglobin molecules.
Incorrect. Most of the carbon dioxide (about 70-80%) is converted to bicarbonate ions and transported in the blood plasma.
